section.title: might and will
section.sectiontitle: We use will + verb to say that something in the future is probable/likely and might + verb to say that something is possible.
section.text1: I think Tony's going to win. (It's very probable.)
section.text1a: I think Tony will win the game.
section.text2: It's possible Chris is going to be late.
section.sectiontitle2: We use won't + verb to say that something is unlikely/not probable and might not + verb to say that something is less possible.
section.text3: I don't think it's going to rain.
section.text4: It's possible that he isn't going to university.
